intro: Polymeria quadrivalvis, commonly known as the four-valved polygonella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a low-growing, mat-forming habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing a distinctive yellow to orange coloration. Polymeria quadrivalvis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
